title: Bingsu
ingredient: toppings such as mochi or nuts
preparation: Shave ice finely and pile it into a bowl
Drizzle with sweetened condensed milk
then add a layer of red bean paste
Top with assorted fruits and additional toppings as desired
Serve immediately for a refreshing treat!

title: Kimchi
preparation: Cut the napa cabbage in half and soak it in salted water for several hours.
Prepare a paste with garlic, ginger, red pepper flakes, and fish sauce.
Rinse the cabbage and coat it thoroughly with the spice paste.
Pack the cabbage tightly into a jar, pressing down to remove air.
Let it ferment at room temperature for a few days, then refrigerate.

title: Bibimbap
preparation: Sauté each vegetable separately until tender.
Prepare a sunny-side-up egg.
In a bowl, place a serving of rice and arrange the vegetables on top.
Add the egg and drizzle with sesame oil and gochujang.
Mix everything together before eating.

title: Bulgogi
preparation: Marinate the beef with soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, sesame oil, and black pepper for at least 30 minutes.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the marinated beef and cook until browned and cooked through.
Stir in chopped green onions just before finishing.
Serve hot with rice or lettuce wraps.

title: Tteokbokki
preparation: Soak rice cakes in warm water if they are hard.
In a pan, mix gochujang and sugar with water to create a sauce.
Add the soaked rice cakes and fish cakes to the pan.
Cook until the sauce thickens and the rice cakes are soft.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve with boiled eggs.

title: Japchae
preparation: Soak sweet potato noodles in hot water until soft, then drain.
Saute beef and set aside
Stir-fry vegetables until tender
Combine noodles, beef, and vegetables in a pan
Season with soy sauce and sesame oil, mixing well before serving

title: Jjigae
preparation: In a pot, sauté pork with garlic until browned.
Add kimchi and cook for a few minutes to enhance the flavor.
Pour in water and bring to a boil.
Add tofu and gochugaru, simmering for about 15 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions before serving hot with rice.

title: Kimbap
preparation: Cook rice and mix with a little sesame oil and salt to season.
Julienne the cucumber and carrots, and sauté the carrots until tender.
Scramble the egg and cut it into strips
Lay a seaweed sheet on a bamboo mat, spread a thin layer of rice over it, leaving some space at the top.
Arrange the vegetables and egg in a line across the rice, then roll tightly using the mat.
Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces and serve with soy sauce or pickled radish on the side.
